required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability of Kiddi® Pharmaton Fizz Effervescent Tablets in Children
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Tolerability of Kiddi® Pharmaton Fizz Effervescent Tablets, Comparing the Marketed Formula With an Improved One With a Reduced Mineral Amount, and a Comparator Product: a Double-blind, Controlled, Randomised, Three Arm Cross-over Study in Children

brief_summary.textblock: Study to evaluate the tolerability and safety of Kiddi® Pharmaton Fizz effervescent tablets, in children of 6 to 14 years, comparing a given formula with an improved one with reduced mineral content (qualitatively equivalent to the first one) and a comparator product.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of total drug-related adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of all individual drug-related adverse events
Assessment of overall tolerability and acceptance on a 4-point verbal rating scale

arm_group.arm_group_label: Kiddi® Pharmaton Fizz, effervescent tablets: marketed formula

arm_group.description: in the form of a product that is a market leader

intervention.intervention_name: Kiddi® Pharmaton Fizz, effervescent tablets: marketed formula
intervention.arm_group_label: Kiddi® Pharmaton Fizz, effervescent tablets: marketed formula

intervention.description: active substances: Vitamin A, Vitamin B1, Vitamin B2, Vitamin B5, Vitamin B6, Vitamin B12, Vitamin C, Vitamin D, Vitamin E, Manganese, Copper, Calcium, Magnesium, Phosphorous, Iron, Zinc, Sodium, Molybden

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children of both sexes aged between 6 and 14 years, inclusive
- Children, healthy or during convalescence, for which prevention or treatment of marginal vitamin deficits is indicated
- Willingness of the children and parents to give their written informed consent, according to Good Clinical Practice and local regulations
- Pregnant children will not be excluded
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has taken medications containing vitamins A or D, retinoids, or iron during the 4 weeks preceding the study enrolment
- Pre-treatment (less than 2 weeks prior the inclusion in this trial) and/or concomitant treatment with any drug that may influence the trial symptomatology, and may interfere with the evaluation of the safety of the test drug
- Participation in other clinical trials within the last 4 weeks and concurrent participation in another clinical trial
- Relevant allergy or kown hypersensitivity to one of the ingredients of the investigational drug
- Has any serious disorder that may interfere with the participation to the trial
- Malabsorption syndrome, liver and/or renal diseases or juvenile diabetes
- Increased calcium blood concentration, or an increased calcium-excretion
- Evident states of protein deficiency
- Presence of lysinemia (defect of the enzyme lysine ketoglutarate reductase)
